str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To be well-pleased, think it good, be resolved. From eu and dokeo; to think well of, i.e. Approve; specially, to approbate.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From asthenes; feebleness; by implication, malady; morally, frailty.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
(a) insult, injury, outrage, (b) damage, loss. From huper; insolence, i.e. Insult, injury.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From ana and the base of agkale; constraint; by implication, distress.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Chase, pursuit; persecution. From dioko; persecution.
And, even, also, namely.
A narrow space, great distress, anguish. From a compound of stenos and chora; narrowness of room, i.e. calamity.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) of persons: powerful, able, (b) of things: possible. From dunamai; powerful or capable; neuter possible.
